comments.body: Love this idea! Makes building much more customizable. I understand that this would work for diorite, andesite and granite, but, I think they need a texture rework as well, as imagining diorite bricks just gives me shivers.
yea, i'm not a fan of diorite either. but, others i think this would be great.

I agree, but have these variants: rough/raw, cobble, cobble bricks, pillars, large brick, cut/small brick, chiseled, polished, smooth, tile, cracked bricks.

Polished (Similar to existing)

Smooth (Smoothed soft texture similar to rough)

Tile (Similar to purpur blocks)

Cobble Bricks (Rough inconsistent bricks)

How to craft them:

Cobble - Mine rough without silk touch

Cobble Brick - 2*2 of cobble

Rough - Cook cobble

Large Brick - 2*2 of rough

Small Brick - 2*2 of large brick

Cracked Brick - Cook either brick type

Smooth - Cook rough

Polished - 2*2 of smooth

Tiles - 2*2 of polished

Pillar - 1*2 of rough, polished, tile, brick or small brick.

Chiseled - 2*2 of any slab.

Stairs/slabs/walls for these types with regular recipes: Cobble, cobble brick, rough, large and small brick, smooth, tile and polished.

Additions to The Golden Creeper comment: 

Grid variant (Similar to dark prismarine) - 2*2 of tiles

Also chiseled recipe should stay as current - 1*2 of slabs

And maybe combine polished and smooth variants into one smooth variant among all stone types just because current smooth stone and polished granite and others look pretty the same, but for some reason have different recipes. Or get rid of idea of cobble bricks, make polished variants by 2*2 of cobble and smooth - by cooking rough/raw.
Eucalyptus deglupta basically

I mean cool, but we already use gold for beacons, tools, and armor plus it has an ingot and a nugget form and can be made into a block. That and it is use to make Gapples and Enchanted apples plus golden carrots how much more do we need???????

You're right, except for the fact that you aren't comparing it to anything. Iron - used in more than 30 crafting recipes. So if you think about it, Gold is highly underused. Its  that it isn't available in many useful crafting recipes, like,  why would you want Gold tools?

Nobody uses golden tools at all, not to mention all the memes making fun of golden tools, gold is often brushed past in caves when mining for iron, coal, or diamonds, so making at least a few new crafting recipes and uses for gold would be good, perhaps an entire update for gold would be too much, but like I said, more crafting recipes and uses would make a use to collect gold more often in caves.

How about adding a gold leaf recipe? When this material is crafted into other blocks it puts gold color in the contours of the block. This would make for an interesting cobblestone block. Stairs would have the edges bordered in gold.

No

No

Yes
yo thats a good idea :)
I like it
To Mojang please add this feature or at least make it that when you hold torches it creates light
First of all, we need a dynamic lighting

I think that with the new addition of bees, there needs to be a use for the honeycomb (or possibly the honeycomb block). I think I found a good use for it.

Please make it possible to make wax out of honeycomb somehow (either craft it or smelt it). After this, you could make a candle using one wax and string for a short candle and two wax and string for a tall candle.

The candle would be a decorative lighting source. Really sets the mood, but the coolest use for the candle would be the ability to turn an iron helmet into a miners helmet by putting an iron helmet and a candle into a crafting table or in the 2x2 crafting place in your inventory (this is MINEcraft after all). This would produce a small amount of wearable light while you were down in the mine.

Lemme know what you think!
If they added candles, they could just craft mining candles (which would give light when held) by putting 3 gold nuggets on the bottom row and 1 candle in the center
This sounds really cool!
maybe right click the map on a cauldron full of water
Octaipanic nailed it, right click (or console equivalent) over a cauldron
I think it should be a guaranteed drop as a reward for conquering the monument. Maybe drowned armed with tridents should still be able to drop it, albeit with a lower chance

The trident can be very powerful, so it would make sense if it were a little harder to acquire. Maybe instead of having so many materials, though, the three that spawn naturally (if I’m right) all drop a broken piece of the trident.

They should definitely be limited to ocean monuments. Ocean monuments used to be relevant if you wanted to build underwater because sponges were the only "efficient" way to get rid of water source blocks. Conduits destroyed the need to do that. And tridents are such versatile weapons they really should be harder to get.
Get one trident prong from each elder guardian.
tips of friend should be prismarine shards
Yes! Ocean Monuments need more to them! This is definitely it
Not only iron, but any ore
Would be great if they implement a new ore
This would be too easy for finding ores
I think it should just be 1 pressure plate + 1 carpet

A carpeted pressure plate would work well as it's own block, being crafted with a pressure plate and a carpet block. To make it not completely unfair, it could have a slightly different texture, e.g. having little grey or red bits to show the plate or redstone beneath.

great idea! that would be great for my secret bases. imagine just seeing a bunch of carpet with a pressure plate in the middle, thinking that its only carpet. I just want the crafting recipe to be:

 

                                                                                               ccc

                                                                                               cpc

                                                                                               ccc

                                                                         c: carpet. p: pressure plate.
Crafting: carpet + pressure plate
This would be great for traps in adventure maps. Heck, this could even be used for secret rooms and passageways, like the classic "swinging" Jeb door hidden in the wall.
This is already a thing.
A minor inconvenience when it happens doesn't really bother me but I would like to see this change.

@BuilderJayMC Yes, this is a minor change and there are other more pressing features I'd like to see done before this (which I can't communicate unless something like this is implemented), but it becomes very noticable when placing lots of single-slabs.
@Blast Burner I don't know what you mean. When you mine a double slab block (java edition 1.14 and below), it turns into air and drops two slab items. Is this a thing in bedrock edition?
So many of my ideas got deleted because they were related to the snapshots so I read the snapshot post saying that we could repost our ideas back into other similar categories. At least I think so.

Hmm. This is quite the conundrum. I see the crossbow as the competitor to the bow and if the crossbow becomes too powerful it will render the bow obsolete. Perhaps the power enchantment on the crossbow should go only to III.

I think that the Power 5 enchantment on the Crossbow would make sense for these following reasons:

1) The Flame, Punch, and Infinity enchantments on the Bow already help it by having more capabilities that with the Crossbow you cannot burn and knock back the target and you cannot get unlimited ammo(unless they're tipped)

2) The Crossbow has less durability then a Bow which would give this it's balance for power

3) The Crossbow is suppose to be the more superior long ranged weapon to the Bow but when enchanted, the Bow has the win

4) The Bow has multiple other capabilities that the current Crossbow doesn't and seeing that every other weapon has a damage upgrade it would seem wrong that the Crossbow wouldn't
I think the crossbow needs power enchantment，Because it's so weak now.a power V bow can kill a 20 health mob with one shot,to crossbow needs 3 shots.i don't have any reason to use crossbow.
YES!!! crossbow is Underpowered! NOT worth using because of that, otherwise i would.
Make the food plate placeable like a pressure plate, but put the food on after it is placed to get more food points. Same thing with bowls.
Opino que las esmeraldas no sólo sirvan para intercambios sino que también sirvan para hacer armaduras o items más fuerte que el hierro pero menos que el diamante

I could really use this right now too! Should already be in the game. Great suggestion.

Wish they would just do a Vanilla+ Update and add any and all items that should have been could have been and needed to already be in the original game from the start.
Would be handy for organisation. I know you can use signs but it can still be tricky to line up the chests with the signs, as placing the signs on the chests tends to get in the way.
Maybe it would have a higher chance when near a Sea Temple.
I Love Dragons
It would not make sense because coral needs water to live so if the would add it should die when you put it in a flower pot
I have to agree with Cameron on this one afraid. Sorry.

I like the idea but I don't know how keeping it alive would work like the other comments are suggesting. Maybe it has to be 1 block and no further than a water source or flowing water? Or instead of the dirt texture being on the inside of the pot it could be water?
In order to keep the coral alive, you should be able to waterlog the flower pots. Also don't forget coral fans!
That would be awesome I have 4 large chests of unusable cobblestone items
oh my god i need this right now
It could be shown in clocks! It could give them more of an use XV
The word you want is "visible", because "seeable" is not an actual word. I'll vote, though, since it's a decent idea
Hi, blueberries, strawberries, bananas, avocados or cherries would be sooooooooooooo cooool!!!
I was thinking that in my game
I believe wool should be able to be crafted into dye and/or string

Dyed wool should make dyed string, and white wool should just make string. The dyed string would be whatever color the wool was. When using dyed string to craft, you could have a cool new texture on your bow or fishing rod.
Uh, you CAN turn wool into string.

I think our ideas can work together. 

I have an idea for a Minecraft item update. Could you make a Minecraft wand? To make it, you need a stick and you need to go to the Nether to get these nether shards, then head back home. At home, you use a crafting table to craft the wand. Craft the wand by putting all the nether shards around and a stick in the middle. Then you get out and you have the wand.

At first the wand will not do anything and then if you have level 30, you can enchant it. Then with the enchanted wand you can shoot fireballs, maybe you could throw mobs in the air and it takes some damage, and maybe you could throw fire snowballs instead that does seven attack damage, when you throw a mob in the air it does nine attack damage, and you can poison a mob and they will have half a heart. If you poison the boss, it won’t leave them at half a heart it’ll still have a lot of hearts but the enchanted wand can still do a little bit of damage.

Also, you can have an invisible shield for 20 seconds and when the shield goes away you’ll have to have a five minute warm-up and you will have a little timer on the side and it will tell you when you could use it again.

I think it would be a fun thing to try out!
I really would like flutes in Minecraft!
I really would like flutes in Minecraft!
It would be cool too if you could make your own melodies and also if there were more than two instruments.
